document_title: Anal abscess: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
1. Does an anal abscess go away on its own?
Anal abscesses rarely resolve on their own without medical treatment. Even if symptoms improve after home care, the patient still needs to contact a doctor for examination and diagnosis to avoid recurrence or dangerous complications.
2. Does an anal abscess recur?
An anal abscess has the potential to recur or develop into a fistula even after medical treatment. Research shows that the recurrence rate tends to be proportional to body mass index (BMI). Therefore, even after treatment, patients should have regular follow-up examinations for accurate monitoring and examination.
